meanings.definition: To make Western in character or customs.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to occidentalize her wardrobe by adding more jeans and t-shirts.
meanings.sent2: The school curriculum was occidentalized to include more European history.
meanings.sent3: Trying to occidentalize a traditional dish by adding ketchup was a culinary disaster.
meanings.sent4: The small town was slowly occidentalizing, with fast-food chains popping up everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The movie director decided to occidentalize the script by setting it in a bustling American city.

meanings.definition: To bring under Western influence or control.
meanings.sent1: The explorer sought to occidentalize the remote tribe by introducing them to Western technology.
meanings.sent2: The colonizers aimed to occidentalize the indigenous population through forced assimilation.
meanings.sent3: The idea of occidentalizing the entire continent with one language seemed both ambitious and impractical.
meanings.sent4: The multinational corporation was accused of occidentalizing local businesses and traditions.
meanings.sent5: The political leader's agenda was focused on occidentalizing the region to align with Western ideologies.
